Title: Senior Researcher, Product Experience (Growth)
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with over 260 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across various genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and change their plans anytime.

The Product Experience Research team is central in uncovering compelling ways to engage and entertain our global members. This Senior Research role supports Growth, which strives to better attract new members to Netflix and explore new monetization opportunities worldwide. Specifically, this role will focus on how Netflix can deliver better value to more members through new ad-supported offerings.

This is an opportunity to lead innovative research with demonstrable impact on a global scale. You will be responsible for defining, leading, analyzing, and socializing research studies that generate insights to empower business decisions across the company. You’ll partner with cross-functional teams passionate about delivering the most engaging, innovative, and inclusive experiences.


In This Role, You Will


Identify, prioritize, and lead research roadmaps that generate insights to inform monetization strategies across the company.Partner with cross-functional teams, including Product, Ads, Product Marketing, Design, Data Science, Strategy Planning & Analysis, and Brand to proactively develop research initiatives.Define, design, execute, and socialize a range of research studies that build a strong understanding of existing and future audiences and their experiences worldwide.Identify best practices in existing and emerging research methodologies.



About You


Demonstrable experience in product research and/or user experience (UX) research informing growth and monetization strategy. Experience supporting subscription businesses or ad-supported online products preferred.Mixed methods research expertise including hands-on experience leading end-to-end quantitative and qualitative research studiesA balance of creative and analytical skills with the ability to proactively define research questions, identify appropriate methods, execute studies, and synthesize findings.Strong communicator with a bias toward action to proactively collaborate with multiple teams across the company.Passionate about translating findings into actionable strategic business recommendationsGlobal research experience is highly preferred but not required.


Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $110,000 - $440,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

On the Marketing Analytics team reporting to the Director of Marketing Analytics, you will support projects including forecasting, AB testing, reporting, competitor data analysis, and ad hoc analysis.

Have you ever found a new favorite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energized to roll up their sleeves and help realize Confluent’s enormous potential. About The Role

Marketing Strategy and Insights is a team of analysts within the Marketing Operations organization at Confluent. This team serves as internal analytical consultants to all parts of the Marketing organization, focusing on delivering targeted insights into key components of the marketing engine including website conversion analytics, digital and in-person marketing campaign performance, marketing pipeline attribution and ROI, Product Led Growth analytics, lead scoring, lead management, and more.

What You Will Do

 This Senior Marketing Analyst role we’re hiring for will specifically focus on website and digital marketing program analytics.  Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Confluent including Web, Digital Marketing, Marketing Operations, Data Science, Field Marketing, Finance, and more to drive the execution of strategic or tactical recommendations  You’ll apply your analytical and strategic skillset to help optimize the effectiveness of Confluent’s website and digital channels as conversion engines for our business, focusing on: Digital performance reports, dashboards, and optimization  Experiment analyses and consultation  Web event and digital channel tracking and reporting  Web and digital marketing forecasting  Exploratory analyses, working with Data Science on classification or predictive model  Be proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement within your area of ownership, scope and prioritize projects, and spearhead the execution of analytically-driven recommendations in support of key business objectives 
What You Will Bring

 5+ years of experience in an analytics role supporting a go-to-market organization  Bachelor’s Degree in Business, or quantitative field such as Analytics, Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering  2+ years of experience in SQL querying  Experience with modern website, marketing, and data technology stacks such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Segment, Marketo, Bigquery  Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau  Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets  Familiarity with Salesforce or other CRM software  Be able to own and execute an agenda in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment  Strong business judgment: Be a tenacious decision maker, able to assess priorities and execute to drive key business outcomes  Strong communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills  Clear results orientation: display the ability to scope and execute on projects in service of both short and long-term goals

Title: Senior Market Researcher
Description:
Grammarly is excited to offer a remote-first hybrid working model. Team members work primarily remotely in the United States, Canada, Ukraine, Germany, or Poland. Certain roles have specific location requirements to facilitate collaboration at a particular Grammarly hub.

All roles have an in-person component: Conditions permitting, teams meet 2–4 weeks every quarter at one of Grammarly’s hubs in San Francisco, Kyiv, New York, Vancouver, and Berlin, or in a workspace in Kraków. This flexible approach gives team members the best of both worlds: plenty of focus time along with in-person collaboration that fosters trust and unlocks creativity.

Grammarly team members in this role will collaborate in person 2 weeks per quarter, traveling if necessary to different hubs. They are required to live within a commutable distance of their home hub of San Francisco. Grammarly may provide relocation assistance.

The opportunity

Grammarly is the world’s leading AI writing assistance company trusted by over 30 million people and 70,000 professional teams every day. From instantly creating a first draft to perfecting every message, Grammarly’s product offerings help people at 96% of the Fortune 500 get their point across—and get results. Grammarly has been profitable for over a decade because we’ve stayed true to our values and built an enterprise-grade product that’s secure, reliable, and helps people do their best work—without selling their data. We’re proud to be one of Inc.’s best workplaces, a Glassdoor Best Place to Work, one of TIME’s 100 Most Influential Companies, and one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in AI.

To achieve our ambitious goals, we’re looking for a Customer Insights Researcher to join our Human Insights team. Our team is responsible for uncovering insights into our customers’ needs and behaviors to influence and inspire all levels of the company. We work with functions across product, design, and marketing, and our goal is to build our business with users at its center. The Customer Insights Researcher role will execute mixed-methods research primarily on marketing-related topics.

This is an ideal role for someone passionate about using research to identify strategic marketing opportunities, improve advertising, and strengthen brand positioning. This position will report to the Marketing and Growth Research Manager on the Human Insights team.

Your impact

As a Customer Insights Researcher, you will work directly with our Human Insights team to execute mixed-methods research studies. Applying your breadth of knowledge in primary research, you will enable first-class research on brand, advertising, and communications initiatives.

In This Role, You Will

Define research plans and conduct market research studies with clearly stated goals and research questions.Generate a deep understanding of our customers and their communication needs to influence and shape Grammarly’s strategic marketing plans.Lead qualitative and quantitative primary research such as moderate focus groups, design surveys, synthesize data into key insights. Build studies that leverage best practices in customer segmentation, brand tracking, message testing, ad testing, opportunity/market sizing, and concept testing, among others.Conduct research-brainstorming workshops with cross-functional teams to help identify research needs and opportunities to drive strategic GTM motions.Connect and identify internal and external data points to provide a holistic understanding of our users and seize opportunities for growth.Synthesize and communicate research findings to advise GTM decisions through rich storytelling in presentations, reports, workshops, or other creative approaches. Explore and be creative in developing research methods on the topic of communication and writing.Participate in building the research practice at Grammarly through mentoring, hiring, and building or selecting research tools and resources. Build relationships and establish thought-leader presence among cross-functional partners in Marketing, Growth, Design, and Product.

Title: Senior Marketing Insights Analyst

But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Why We Have This Role

Qualtrics is on a mission to transform the way businesses engage with their customers and employees, armed with data-driven decisions and unparalleled agility in an experience-driven world. As a Marketing Strategy Analyst, you will be the heartbeat of our strategic ventures, steering our marketing ship towards untapped opportunities. In close synergy with our Marketing, Sales, and Partnerships teams, your analysis will not only forecast trends but also actively shape the future of our engagement with prospects. Your insight will be the bridge between raw data and strategic triumph, catalyzing our continued growth and helping us reach new heights in customer acquisition and retention.

How You’ll Find Success

Acquire and blend marketing and sales data to create meaningful insights and drive strategic decisions.Skilled in data visualization and crafting compelling stories from raw data.Strong collaboration skills and ability to build relationships across various functions.An action-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering results within deadlines.Meticulous organizational and time management skills that ensure precision in your work.

How You’ll Grow

Develop a deep understanding of the marketing-sales funnel in a high-growth B2B SaaS environment.Enhance your data analytics skills with opportunities to work on complex, multi-source datasets.Cultivate your strategic thinking through the identification and execution of growth-driving initiatives.Sharpen your communication skills with regular presentations to senior stakeholders and cross-functional projects.Expand your technical proficiency with continuous learning and application of new tools and methodologies in data analysis.

Things You’ll Do

Conduct holistic funnel analysis to optimize the transition of leads to opportunities.Transform complex data sets into actionable insights using analytical, visualization, and data tools such as Tableau, Excel, Python, R, MySQL, etc. Create queries, views, reports, and easy-to-consumption dashboards/visualizations. Synthesize data from diverse sources to construct targeted lists that drive campaign success.Partner with marketing teams to develop personalization strategies and advance targeting techniques.Champion data-driven decisions in marketing investment and resource allocation.

What We’re Looking For On Your Resume

3-5 years of experience in a marketing analytics role, ideally within a B2B SaaS environment.Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline or marketing/communications with an analytical focus.Experience with Python/R or SAS for blending and analyzing complex datasets.Demonstrated ability to use SQL for complex data queries and familiarity with other data analysis tools.A proven history of improving marketing campaign performance through insightful analyses.Evidence of strong communication skills and the effective use of data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, R, or Domo.

What You Should Know About This Team

Innovation is our team's heart-rate; we lead with creativity and embrace continuous improvement as we redefine marketing analytics.We value knowledge sharing and collective problem-solving, ensuring a supportive environment where every opinion is valued.Impact-oriented, we celebrate meaningful contributions that drive the company forward, and we're committed to individual career development.

Our Team’s Favorite Perks And Benefits

Top-down commitment to creating an environment that encourages personal and professional growth, with tailored development opportunities.Flexible working arrangements to ensure a balance between a fun and collaborative office experience and Generous health and wellness programs--including an annual experience bonus--that cater to the well-being of every team member.Fast-paced environment where we have a laugh and don’t take ourselves too seriously.Excellent working relationships with our marketing leadership and counterparts.

These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Title: Market Research Analyst - Fistula Fix
Description:
Position Overview

The KU School of Business and Management and Entrepreneurship Area has coordinated with Fistula Fix to provide a business student internship opportunity as a Market Research Analyst.

The Market Research Analyst will gain hands-on experience in market research, estimating market size, creating financial projections, and delivering a comprehensive presentation. The position will contribute to strategic decision-making processes by providing valuable insights into market trends, potential opportunities, and financial viability. This will be an iterative process where additional work may be suited based on initial findings.

This is a part-time position, up to 10 hours per week, until a minimum of 120 hours is achieved. This position will start late March and continue until the end of the Fall 2024 semester. Due to the collaborative position, the Market Research Analyst position will be remote and will report to both the Director of Entrepreneurship Co-Curricular Programs at the University of Kansas School of Business and the Entrepreneur in Residence at KU Medical Center. This position is contingent on funding.

Fistula Fix, an early-stage start-up company, is creating next-generation speculum used in women's exams for pelvic health, pregnancy, and diagnosing cervical cancer.

Job Description

The Market Research Analyst position will (a) conduct market research, (b) determine estimated market size, (c) develop financial projections, (d) prepare a presentation, and (e) deliver a final presentation.

Duties include, but are not limited to:

Market Research

Conduct primary and secondary research to gather information on industry trends, customer preferences, and competitor analysis.Utilize online databases, industry reports, surveys, and interviews to collect data.Analyze market trends, customer demographics, and purchasing behaviors.Document findings and present preliminary insights to the team for feedback.


Market Size

Apply acquired knowledge to estimate the total addressable market (TAM) and serviceable available market (SAM).Utilize various methodologies such as bottom-up and top-down.Validate assumptions and refine market size estimates based on feedback and additional research.Prepare a comprehensive report outlining the methodology used and the final market size estimates.


Financial Projections

Develop financial models to forecast revenue, expenses, and investment needs.Incorporate market research findings and market size estimates into the financial projections.Present the financial projections to stakeholders and solicit feedback for refinement.


Presentation Preparation

Synthesize research findings, market analysis, and financial projections into a compelling narrative.Create a visually engaging presentation using PowerPoint or other presentation tools.Practice delivery of the presentation to enhance communication and presentation skills.Solicit feedback from mentors and peers to refine the presentation content and delivery.


Final Presentation and Wrap-Up

Deliver the final presentation to key stakeholders, including the Innovator Team and Digital Health Co/Lab.Articulate key findings, insights, and recommendations based on the research and analysis conducted.Address questions and engage in discussions to clarify any aspects of the presentation.Reflect on the internship experience, lessons learned, and areas for future growth.Prepare a comprehensive report summarizing the internship activities, achievements, and recommendations for the company's future strategies.


Required Qualifications

Must be a KU student enrolled in at least 6 credit hours (during spring and fall semesters).Demonstrated evidence of coachability, time management, and/or self-leaderships skills based on application materials.Demonstrated evidence of creativity, based on application materials.Evidence of strong communication skills.


During the semester term of the appointment, the KU student hourly must be enrolled in no fewer than 6 credit hours. For summer periods the student hourly must: 1) have been enrolled in no less than 6 hours in the past spring semester or 2) be pre-enrolled in upcoming fall semester in no less than 6 hours or 3) be enrolled in summer session or 4) be admitted to study in the upcoming fall semester. Student Hourlies may be undergraduate or graduate students.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Excel spreadsheets.


Additional Candidate Instructions

A complete application requires:

On-line applicationCover letterCurrent resume


Initial review of applications begins March 15, 2024, and will continue as needed until the position is filled.

Director of Entrepreneurship Co-Curricular Programs

ryan.rains@ku.edu

Maria Flynn

Commercialization & Business Development Entrepreneur in Residence

mflynn3@kumc.edu

Advertised Salary Range

$10 - $14/hr, depending upon experience

Work Schedule

Up to 10 hours per week, flexible

Monday March 25, 2024

Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

The Marketing Analytics Specialist Analyst will support the forecasting, reporting, and performance analysis of programs within the marketing operations and digital marketing teams. We are looking for a marketer that has hands-on experience reporting data-driven insights to support our marketing team’s strategic decisions. This role will be pivotal in gathering and communicating insights from digital marketing channels, campaigns, and tools and how they impact business value.

This role plays a crucial part in understanding marketing effectiveness, identifying trends and providing insights to enhance marketing initiatives. This role presents an incredible opportunity to develop standard, repeatable marketing performance dashboard that will help measure KPIs to reflect impact and success against business objective and goals. The role will sit within the Authorize.net brand of Visa Acceptance Solutions, an open, digital payments management platform.

This Position Will Be Responsible For:

Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to understand the effectiveness of digital media channels and marketing campaigns. Measurement of ROI for both online and offline advertising campaigns. Regular reporting on marketing KPIs such as leads, conversion rates, website performances, social media engagements, and email campaign metrics. Support for inter-technology integration to automate manual processes. Align with budget planning and finance business partner to manage forecast and budgeted spend, revenue and return on investment. Use data visualization tools like Datorama to present data in a clear, concise manner that informs decision making. Work closely with the marketing team to understand goals and define metrics for the programs/initiatives. Identify trends and insights in data to optimize spend and performance. Active management of marketing attributions for tracking and reporting performance. Management of ad-hoc reporting in Tableau. Ensure accuracy of data reporting and provide regular reports to the marketing team and senior management. Assist in the preparation of regular marketing reports for stakeholders and senior management. Monitoring of budget distribution and management of invoicing, billings, and spend analytics. 

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications:

3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)

Knowledge and experience with the gamut of marketing tools including but not limited to Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Sprinklr, Twitter, YouTube, CRM (MSD preferred).

Experience in gathering and communicating digital and marketing campaign insights.

Intermediate knowledge of data visualization tool (Tableau, Datorama, Power BI etc.).

Experience working with and corralling information across multiple stakeholders including internal and external partners and agencies to gather metrics and KPIs that support digital marketing and operations goals.

Excellent analytical skills with ability to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data, to present with impact to a variety of stakeholders.

Ability to extract learnings and improvement opportunities for digital campaigns.

Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel.

Proven ability to thrive in high pressure situations and a fast paced and matrixed environment.

Comfortable in juggling multiple projects while quick to adapt to shifting priorities.

Innovative and curious, positive, and proactive – always looking for ways to do things better.

This role is not eligible for employment sponsorship

This position requires the incumbent to travel for work up to 10% of the time.
